_comment: Created by EFisher on 24/01/2014 16:53:48 using v2.0
title: How has the proportion of women having a cervical screening changed by age?
analysis_commentary: We have seen that overall cervical screening coverage for women aged 25-64 increased in 2008. However, current good practice is for women aged 25-49 to be screened every 3.5 years whilst those aged 50-64 should be screened at least every 5 years. When we separate these age groups, the increase in coverage is only seen in women aged 25 to 49, whilst the proportion of women aged 50-64 has decreased over time.
data_source: Health & Social Care Information Centre, breast screening programme and cervical screening programme
